metadata.Title: CVE-2020-3481 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability in the EGG archive parsing module in Clam AntiVirus (ClamAV) Software versions 0.102.0 - 0.102.3 could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service condition on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to a null pointer dereference. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted EGG file to an affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the ClamAV scanning process crash, resulting in a denial of service condition.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-3481` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-base - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamdscan - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libclamav9 - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
